row.name: Number of Internal Searches
row.acceptedValues: To select all visits who used internal Site Search, use: &segment=searches>0

row.name: Total events
row.acceptedValues: To select all visits who triggered an Event, use: &segment=events>0

row.name: Visitor IP
row.acceptedValues: 13.54.122.1. Select IP ranges with notation: visitIp>13.54.122.0;visitIp<13.54.122.255

row.name: City
row.acceptedValues: Sydney, Sao Paolo, Rome, etc.

row.name: Continent
row.acceptedValues: eur, asi, amc, amn, ams, afr, ant, oce

row.name: Country
row.acceptedValues: de, us, fr, in, es, etc.

row.name: Language
row.acceptedValues: de, fr, en-gb, zh-cn, etc.

row.name: Latitude
row.acceptedValues:
-33.578, 40.830, etc.
You can select visitors within a lat/long range using &segment=lat>X;latM;long

row.name: Region
row.acceptedValues:
01 02, OR, P8, etc.
eg. region=A1;country=fr

row.name: Browser
row.acceptedValues: FF, IE, CH, SF, OP, etc.

row.name: Browser engine
row.acceptedValues: Trident, WebKit, Presto, Gecko, Blink, etc.

row.name: Device type
row.acceptedValues: desktop, smartphone, tablet, feature phone, console, tv, car browser, smart display, camera, portable media player, phablet

row.name: Operating system
row.acceptedValues: WIN, MAC, LIN, AND, IPD, etc.

row.name: User ID
row.acceptedValues: any non empty unique string identifying the user (such as an email address or a username).

row.name: Visit Ecommerce status at the end of the visit
row.acceptedValues: none, ordered, abandonedCart, orderedThenAbandonedCart. For example, to select all visits that have made an Ecommerce order, the API request would contain "&segment=visitEcommerceStatus==ordered,visitEcommerceStatus==orderedThenAbandonedCart"

row.name: Visit ID
row.acceptedValues: Any integer.

row.name: Visit converted a specific Goal Id
Visit converted at least one Goal
Visit type
row.acceptedValues: new, returning, returningCustomer. For example, to select all visitors who have returned to the website, including those who have bought something in their previous visits, the API request would contain "&segment=visitorType==returning,visitorType==returningCustomer"

row.name: Visitor ID
row.acceptedValues: 34c31e04394bdc63 - any 16 Hexadecimal chars ID, which can be fetched using the Tracking API function getVisitorId()

row.name: Keyword
row.acceptedValues: Encoded%20Keyword, keyword

row.name: Referrer Name
row.acceptedValues: twitter.com, www.facebook.com, Bing, Google, Yahoo, CampaignName

row.name: Referrer Type
row.acceptedValues: direct, search, website, campaign

row.name: Referrer URL
row.acceptedValues: http%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.org%2Freferer-page.htm

row.name: Action Type
row.acceptedValues: A type of action, such as: pageviews, contents, sitesearches, events, outlinks, downloads

row.name: Content Name
row.acceptedValues: The name of a content block, for instance "Ad Sale"

row.name: Content Piece
row.acceptedValues: The actual content. For instance "ad.jpg" or "My text ad"

row.name: Content Target
row.acceptedValues: For instance the URL of a landing page: "http://landingpage.example.com"

row.name: Interaction
row.acceptedValues: The type of interaction with the content. For instance "click" or "submit".

row.name: Page URL
row.acceptedValues: All these segments must be URL encoded, for example: http%3A%2F%2Fexample.com%2Fpath%2Fpage%3Fquery
